arts.ttl: Three talking points as Barcelona share spoils with Club Brugge in the Champions League
arts.sum: FC Barcelona took a trip to Belgium to face Club Brugge in the Champions League. The game ended 3-3, a thrilling draw, with both teams going at each other’s throats. The Catalan club have not played at their best for quite some time. arts.ttl: De Jong, Eric Garcia react after Club Brugge 3-3 Barcelona – ‘We should have won’
arts.sum: After Barcelona’s 3-3 draw against Club Brugge, captain Frenkie de Jong was among the first players to speak publicly about the disappointing result. The Dutch midfielder didn’t hide his frustration, making it clear that while Barça had enough chances to win, the overall performance wasn’t good enough. “It’s a game that I think we should […] The post De Jong, Eric Garcia react after Club Brugge 3-3 Barcelona – ‘We should have won’ appeared first on Barca Universal.

arts.ttl: Champions League roundup: Club Brugge hold Barcelona in six-goal thriller
arts.sum: Inter maintain perfect start with win over Kairat Almaty Pafos beat Villarreal to earn first Champions League win Barcelona had to settle for a share of the spoils at Club Brugge after a thrilling 3-3 draw but were fortunate the English referee Anthony Taylor ruled out Romeo Vermant’s stoppage-time effort for a foul on the Barça goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny. In a thriller at Brugge’s Jan Breydel Stadium, the home side opened the scoring through Nicolò Tresoldi in the sixth minute. But Barcelona hit back with Ferran Torres scoring from close range two minutes later only for Brugge to regainthe lead in the 17th minute through Carlos Forbs after another quick counter. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Barcelona Player Ratings vs. Club Brugge: Dreadful Defensive Performance Proves Costly
arts.sum: Barcelona’s leaky defense saw them drop points in their visit to Belgium against Club Brugge.
